<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Frost Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2962)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Frost drakes pose an immense danger in the frozen reaches they call home, where they roam far and wide to hunt for prey such as caribou, wolves, small bears, tundra-dwelling people, and even lone [frost giants](/Monsters.aspx?ID=222). These drakes take advantage of long distances to hide from the repercussions of their actions, as they are usually among the most depraved and openly malicious of the drakes. They are also especially insolent and are less likely to back down from a fight compared to other drakes. Many frost drakes have met their ends trying to enact cruelties beyond their means, such as singly taking on a frost giant clan or well-fortified township.

 Frost drakes hunt alone more often than other drakes, due to a scarcity of prey and simple temperament. Although a single frost drake can wreak much destruction on their own, tales of village-dwelling northerners banding together to defend their homes from these rogue menaces are fairly common. A frost drake's hunting grounds are quite large. Those frost drakes that live upon the permanently frozen peaks of high mountains have been known to swoop down to snatch up prey from the lowlands, leaving frozen swaths of earth from their breath as the only sign of their passing. Their frost-covered scales range from deep royal blue to crisp cyan and sometimes

 feature sporadic patches of violet. Their hides are thinner than most drakes'; when a frost drake is inhaling in preparation to launch their signature frozen breath, the monster's ice-blue blood can be seen beneath their scales.

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Frost Drake](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2962)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Cold" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=555" />
<trait label="Dragon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=581" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 132 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=74) ([imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412)) 30 feet, snow vision

**Languages**
[Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +15, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +14, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +2

**Con** +4

**Int** -1

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +1
</row>

**Snow Vision** Snow doesn't impair a frost drake's vision; they ignore [concealment](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) from snowfall.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 25 

**Fort** +17 

**Ref** +15 

**Will** +14 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 115

</row>

**Immunities**
[cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=696)

**Weaknesses**
[fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10

**Retaliatory Strike** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** A creature within reach of the frost drake's tail successfully damages the frost drake with a Strike; **Effect** The frost drake attempts to Strike with their tail. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional 1d6 damage.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet; burrow 20 feet (snow only), climb 20 feet (ice only), fly 50 feet; ice stride

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +17,
**Damage** 2d12+8 piercing plus 1d6 cold

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tail +17 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d10+8 bludgeoning

**Draconic Frenzy** <actions string="Two Actions" />  The frost drake makes two fangs Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

**Freezing Mist Breath** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The frost drake spits a ball of liquid up to 60 feet that explodes into a 20-foot-burst cloud of freezing mist. Those in the burst take 8d6 cold damage (DC 25 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The frost drake can't use Freezing Mist Breath again for 1d6 rounds, during which the mist cakes all surfaces in the area with a sheet of slippery ice that turns the area into [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453).

**Ice Stride**   A frost drake isn't impeded by [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=34) checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

**Speed Surge** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114)) **Frequency** three times per day; **Effect** The frost drake Strides or Flies twice.

</column>
